instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Liquid Damage, No 3V and 5V rails
threads.message:
Liquid damaged board for MBP 13" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, plugged into charger, I get a green, then orange light, no fan spin.  I measured the following:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 12.58
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.42
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>: 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>: 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>: 0

Corrosion/build-up was around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>.  Cleaned up in ultrasonic, but still get the same measurements above.  Can anyone help troubleshoot the <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> circuit - I'm convinced the issue is here somewhere.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Liquid Damage, No 3V and 5V rails
threads.message: Voltage on Pin 23 and pin 12 from <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>...... This seems to be a bad <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> but lets confirm first.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Liquid Damage, No 3V and 5V rails
threads.message: Thank you for the response.  I get 3.41 volts on pin 12 (<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>), and between 0.6 and 0.8 volts on pin 23 (VIN).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Liquid Damage, No 3V and 5V rails
threads.message: VIN is not correct, probably corroded trace.
